Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Parecoxib for Postoperative Analgesia in Total Hip Arthroplasty

Intervention.evidence: parecoxib 40 mg at induction, placebo at wound closure, and parecoxib 40 mg 12 hours after induction (pre); or 3) placebo at induction, parecoxib 40 mg at wound closure, and parecoxib 40 mg 12 hours after induction (post)

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial assessed the analgesic efficacy of parecoxib

Method_Outcome.evidence: Pain scores were recorded every 4 hours for 24 hours using a visual analog scale

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors

Result_Outcome.evidence: Postoperative pain scores were lower in the pre and post groups compared to the control group

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were recorded every 4 hours, with no significant differences in frequency or severity between groups
